caption_original:
This crystal ball was owned and gifted to Prime Minister William Lyon Mackenzie King. With an affinity for the spiritual realm, he often used it to contact his deceased relatives, and mentors such as Sir Wilfrid Laurier for personal and political guidance. 

Discover more artefacts under our care by following #OurVaults on @PCarchaeology. https://twitter.com/pcarchaeology

caption_original:
Is there a more magical place on earth than Nahanni National Park Reserve? We might be biased, but we don‚Äôt think so! Nahanni National Park Reserve is considered a paradise for those adventurers who pursue remote wilderness. Alpinists are drawn to the Cirque of Unclimbables, paddlers explore the heart of the reserve and mountaineers trek, compass in hand, across range, meadow and karst. Interpreters located within the park convey the Dene culture to the curious. Want to learn more?  http://www.pc.gc.ca/en/pn-np/nt/nahanni

To celebrate #Canada150, we're featuring ALL of our 200+ places across our social media accounts. Stay tuned!

caption_original:
Prince Albert National Park was officially opened on this day, 1928 by Prime Minister William Lyon Mackenzie King. This park offers accessible wilderness and extensive outdoor recreation in central Saskatchewan. Hike boreal forests, canoe pristine lakes and see free-range bison, with the town of Waskesiu as a convenient base. Can‚Äôt visit this year? Make a date for their 90th in 2018!

To celebrate #Canada150, we're featuring ALL of our 200+ places across our social media accounts. Stay tuned!

http://www.pc.gc.ca/en/pn-np/sk/princealbert

caption_original:
How did people live in the 19th century? Discover the life and work of former Prime Minister Wilfrid Laurier while visiting the typical Quebec home of his youth at Sir Wilfred Laurier House National historic Site. A charming collection of artifacts and old furnishings will help you better understand the lifestyle of residents of yesteryear. National Historic Sites in Quebec, Parks Canada

To celebrate #Canada150, we're featuring ALL of our 200+ places across our social media accounts. Did you know 2017 also marks the centennial of national historic sites? Stay tuned!

http://www.pc.gc.ca/en/lhn-nhs/qc/wilfridlaurier
